faults.symptoms: Rattling noise on cold start, check engine light
faults.verdictImplication: Critical: Verify if TSB 21-2119 has been performed. If not, deduct $3,500 from valuation.
Moderate: Software updates may fix it, but hardware failure requires rebuild.
High Risk: If unchecked, destroys entire transmission ($5k).
Severe: Requires head removal. Avoid high mileage units without proof of repair.

faults.symptoms: Sagging rear end, compressor running constantly
faults.verdictImplication: Common: Plan for conversion to coil springs ($1,500) eventually.

faults.symptoms: Ticking noise on cold start (The 'Hemi Tick')
faults.verdictImplication: Annoyance: Often broken bolts. Inspect carefully before buying.

faults.symptoms: Shudder between 25-50 mph, check engine light
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Software update might fix early stages, otherwise requires replacement.

faults.symptoms: Grinding noise on startup, failure to start
faults.verdictImplication: Minor: Common wear item but expensive on this model.

faults.symptoms: Low oil light, fouled spark plugs (V6 Only)
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: VCM muzzler device can prevent this if caught early.

faults.symptoms: Loss of power, whining noise, failure to accelerate
faults.verdictImplication: Critical: Avoid 2013-2015 models entirely. Transmission is a ticking time bomb.
High Risk: Ensure fluid changes were done every 30k miles. Otherwise walk away.
Moderate: Extended warranty exists (10 years), verify VIN eligibility.

faults.symptoms: Gas smell in oil, rising oil level (1.5T engine)
faults.verdictImplication: Check: Verify software update 18-137 has been applied.
Low Risk: Rare, but verify no abnormal noises during test drive.
Annoyance: Mostly noise, but can stretch chain over long term.
Minor: Technical Service Bulletin fixes exist but may not fully resolve.
Moderate: Check for software update first.

faults.symptoms: Delayed engagement, high RPM before shifting
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Often software related, but check for latest TSBs.
Critical: Inspect frame coating thoroughly before purchase.
Moderate: Inspect for pink crust around pulley.

faults.symptoms: Violent steering wheel shaking after hitting bump
faults.verdictImplication: Common: Usually track bar or ball joints. Negotiate repair cost.

faults.symptoms: Electrical ghosts, fuel pump relay failure
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Can cause stalling.
High Risk: Avoid air suspension on used models if possible.
Critical: Requires engine replacement. Avoid 1.5L/1.6L engines.
Severe: 6F35 transmission is weak point.
Severe: Internal water pump failure destroys engine.
Common: Power Transfer Unit needs frequent fluid changes.

faults.symptoms: Low oil light, engine noise (early models)
faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Can lead to timing chain failure.
Common: Poor weld quality on factory condensers.
Moderate: Fluid flush with specific additive often fixes it.
Annoyance: Expensive if all fail.

faults.symptoms: Shudder or vibration at low speeds
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Software update or fluid change may help.
Minor: Recall issued for some years.
Critical: Extended warranty to 100k miles. Verify coverage.
Moderate: Short block replacement often needed.
Severe: Precursor to engine failure (Nu 2.0L).
Common: Characteristic of the DCT, software updates help.
Critical: Verify if engine has been replaced under recall.
Critical: Oil starvation issue. Check for recall completion.
Severe: 3.3L V6 head bolts can strip.
Annoyance: Screen replacement usually required.
Minor: Common maintenance item.
Critical: Engine interference design. Failure destroys engine.
Critical: High failure rate. Avoid used units without warranty.
Severe: Known 2013-2014 issue ('Judder Code P17F0').

faults.symptoms: Error message when car is in park
faults.verdictImplication: Minor: Switch in shifter assembly fails.
Moderate: Requires transmission removal to replace.
High Risk: Early models (2014-2015) particularly bad.
Cosmetic: Glue failure.
Cosmetic: Expensive assembly to replace.
Minor: Rear bearings fail prematurely.
Common: Upper control arm ball joints dry out.
Moderate: 2020-2021 models had sensor failures.
Recall: Denso fuel pump recall. Verify completion.
Critical: Plastic guides break. 2012-2015 models most at risk.
Critical: Wrist pin alignment issue on early W205s.
Common: Thermo-management module leaks.
Common: Delamination of touch layer.
Severe: Same issue as F-150.
Critical: Recall exists, verify engine health.
Moderate: Labor intensive repair.

faults.symptoms: Truck dies instantly, 'Low Fuel Pressure', no restart
faults.verdictImplication: CATASTROPHIC: Pump sends metal shavings into all injectors and lines. Total fuel system replacement required.

faults.symptoms: Violent shaking of steering wheel after irregular road surface
faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Track bar and damper failure. Dangerous at highway speeds.

faults.symptoms: Slipping gears, burnt fluid smell, limp mode
faults.verdictImplication: Critical: The stock transmission cannot handle the Cummins torque. Expect failure near 150k miles.
Engine Killer: A $2 bolt can destroy a $12k engine. Inspect immediately.

faults.symptoms: Rattling noise from engine front (5.0L SC)
faults.verdictImplication: Financial Ruin: Requires engine removal. Often exceeds vehicle value. SELL IMMEDIATELY.
Common: Compressor wears out due to leak overwork.

faults.symptoms: Blue smoke from exhaust after idling (N63 V8)
faults.verdictImplication: High Risk: Engine burns extensive oil. Repair labor is intensive.
Critical: Plastic guides shatter and clog oil pickup.
Moderate: Wear item on high mileage units.
Severe: Piston ring issues on early 3.0T/2.0T engines. Requires rebuild.

faults.symptoms: Door stuck, motor grinding, battery drain
faults.verdictImplication: Common: Cable or motor failure. Expensive convenience repair.
Moderate: Software updates help, but torque converter may fail.
Critical: Widespread issue on Hybrid Pacificas. Engine replacement likely.
Dangerous: Transmission wiring harness recall. Verify VIN.
Severe: High failure rate on early L83 engines. Requires partial engine teardown.

faults.symptoms: Door won't open or close automatically
faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Common convenience failure. Cable and motor assembly replacement.
Critical: Cost often exceeds 50% of vehicle market value. SELL RECOMMENDED.

faults.symptoms: Vehicle sagging, bumpy ride, compressor running constantly
faults.verdictImplication: High Risk: Expensive Nitro-charged system. Consider coil spring conversion.

faults.symptoms: Rattle on start, engine won't turn over (Valve jump)
faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Can result in complete engine destruction if it skips a tooth.
Moderate: A known weak point in the B48/B58 engines. Requires replacement with updated unit.
faults.symptoms: Oil leak onto hot engine, burning smell, coolant contamination

faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Extremely common on VAG 2.0T engines. Plastic housing warps.
faults.symptoms: Overheating warning, puddles under front of car

faults.verdictImplication: Moderate: Mercedes multi-link suspension is sensitive to bushing wear.
faults.symptoms: Clunking over bumps, uneven tire wear

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Critical failure on early Drive-E engines. Requires engine rebuild or replacement.
faults.symptoms: Low oil light every 1000 miles, blue smoke

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: High risk of catastrophic engine failure. Check recall status immediately.
faults.symptoms: Knocking noise, oil light flicker, engine stall

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Major reliability hazard. Repair cost often exceeds 50% of value on high-mileage units.
faults.symptoms: Metallic rattling, sudden loss of power

faults.verdictImplication: CATASTROPHIC: Coolant leaks into cylinders due to block design. Engine replacement required.
faults.symptoms: White smoke, misfires on startup, chronic low coolant

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: High labor cost for a gasket repair. Often deferred by owners.
faults.symptoms: Oil seeping onto exhaust manifold, burning smell

faults.verdictImplication: Critical: Radiator failure mixes coolant into transmission. Destroys the gearbox. Pre-2010 models only.
Moderate: Electrical/Control issue common on Hydra-Matic 9T65.
faults.symptoms: Erratic shifting, won't move from Park, limp mode

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: Lifter roller fails and eats the camshaft. Requires major engine teardown.
faults.symptoms: Rhythmic ticking noise at idle, misfires

faults.verdictImplication: Severe: TigerShark 2.4L engine flaw. May require engine replacement if out of warranty.
faults.symptoms: Engine stalling on turns due to low oil, no warning light

faults.verdictImplication: Very Low Risk: Highly reliable platform. Repairs are typically only wear items.
